Disable gravity would have to be all or nothing . Including sand, cement powder, water, lava . I would like a way to modify this behavior in datapack. Perhaps a json file detailing a blocks behavior. I think this can already be done in bedrock (at least I the latest beta?) But as an in game general options I hope no . As a mechanic maybe. Like putting gravel on torch to hold it .
Blocking does not make you sneak.  It slows you down.
Go into your settings app and try to find auto-update, or something along those lines, and turn it on.

Thanks for your contribution.
Clarified topic.

Hi!

We can tell you put in a lot of thought for this idea, and appreciate your feedback!

It appears there is already an existing thread on this topic (or something very similar). Feel free to join that discussion in progress.

Cutting down on duplicate threads or threads with very similar ideas will allow relevant threads and ideas to stay together so they can receive the attention they deserve from our developers.

We want to help everyone have their ideas succeed. Thanks for your contribution.
Input issue, moving to correct category.
Maybe when we get the new menu/interface you could sort our blocks to match Java edition, as this is much more intuitive and efficient.
Yes and if added a function to make your own block or item that will be so cool

This is a fantastic idea. I would even say we should have more than one custom tab (like up to ten even). This solves the problem that the "best" way to organize everything is totally subjective. For example, some people associate trapdoors with Redstone components, while others just use it for decoration.

They should add a switch button on the parameter to choose between the old creative menu (old console edition) and bedrock because... I really don't like the creative menu from bedrock, it's so confusing I hope to see the good old creative menu used on ps4 edition before bedrock edition.
I hoop echt dat dit word toegevoegd
Sinto falta disso, era muito Ãºtil no java
I make structures in minecraft bedrock and I want what have the option "export world" in minecraft bedrock so that others players can export their structures with the structure_block
Would be better with customizable layout, too. I would also like to see a joystick option for movement. Would be better to play minecraft claw imo.
It would be cool if u could attack while move the camera. Whenever I move the camera attacking is disabled.
Adding attack button will be so helpful for mcpe gamer l, and also the custom layout. mcpe controls is still the same for years ðŸ˜­
I posted this on minecraft's subreddit but other people criticized it by saying mojang had to delay the update which is not fair how much time will it take to create an attack button I wanna know
And also said that mobiles are less powerful which doesn't make does that change anything

I agree on this, as a PUBG mobile player, I can see alot of potential in the custom layout for Minecraft PEâ€™s pvp to evolve. Players from Pubg Mobile use multiple finger which are called Claw. Clawing can hold so many potential Minecraft pvpers. I understand that many people are probably not used to it. That is why it should be an option for people who wants to use it, that is why having a custom layout can solve this issue for both sides. Having the custom buttons for hitting and for placing blocks is also a must as it would be very convenient as mcpe currently only supports 2 finger gameplay. Adding buttons would be a huge advantage towards the mobile community in pvp. It might not make sense to people who arenâ€™t experienced in FPS mobile, but I can guarantee this would be a huge success for the pvp community. Well thats all for me, I hope this will get reviewed by a Mojang executive so we can finally pvp while aiming for once
Would not be hard to code either. Why not? Same for seamless connected glass which needs adding.
I agree, it would be nice if the bedrock community could get some sort of option that enables connected textures (especially for glass).

Native Connected Textures support for Minecraft Java as well

I wished connected textures, like from optifine, would be supported by default, because then we would not have so many issues, if we use Fabric.

And Mojang itself could use it to give Minecraft textures more variability, as wished here, for Bedrock, but for Java as well.
Yes, please.

Hello!

I am blind too, but my blindness is more hard and doesn't allow me to see the game, I only can see structures, in a plain world and I use hig contrast buildings to be able to build my home, or something like that. I use obsidian to build, or wood.

 

I am also agree that the more important thing in accessibility needs is the player inventory menu, and have a shortcut to search directly in the search in inventory box, and give narrator the ability to speak quickly what items are you selecting or hovering. also, I think you can add the ID of the item to the sentence narrated, and have the ability in the search box to find items using only their item id.

Other idea is to create  a shortcut, pressing a key that speaks the block you are seeing in the target, and speak any item selection in the inventory

My girlfriend is visually impaired and struggles to see her inventory, crafting, and blocks. If the narrator could read what an item was or group of blocks that would be incredibly helpful to her. Currently, she can't play without sitting extremely close to the tv or without me narrating for her.
I am a visually impaired gamer, and I fully suport this.
I agree! A narrator for inventory would be helpful for my visually impaired friends.
I agree it would also be good if narrator would announce items created as you create them as well as announce all inventory items on every platform including PlayStation 4

Hello,

While I am very impressed by the accessibility in Mine craft Dungeons, I am sadly, not able to say the same thing in the regular edition of mine craft. While menu narration reads the menus, it does not give any useful information once your world loads.

The biggest area that should be looked in to is your inventory. Currently the only thing we are told is 1 of 10, but 1 of 10 what? Slots, Weapons, armor, what are we looking at?

Also, if we come across items, such as a river, or Lava  we do not have any indication that we have found it, unless we pick up the sound.  I think the accessibility team for Dungeons and the team for regular mine craft should get together, because dungeons is playable for me as a totally blind person. While I enjoy a good hack n slash, I would love the ability to craft and create, something that is not found in the latest release.

If Menu narration read the inventory, and read when we came across items, or important locations,  and read tutorial hents such as how to mine, when you approached your mine when you found your house, when you approached your bed for sleeping, etc, it would be a huge help in making the game playable for us. 

Thank you so much for reading this and I hope to see continued work in this area in future updates.
I would also like it if the narrator could read signs in the Minecraft world, and also read named items in Item Frames.

Beta 1.14.39.51 on Android allows "Save to disk" but I cannot locate any file containing my structure.

This may be because the structure_block GUI does not offer a "3D Export" mode, only "Load" or "Save".
On all platforms, structure blocks should be able to export structures from one world to another.
I'd love that!
Entity shadows: off/on, please, dear Mojang Studios...
Please!!!!
Please!!!!
For everyone like me who has trouble using coding and such, please add an option to turn the shadows off. Thank you!!
Concordo
Just turn off fancy graphics
Upvote! Years later haha.
Simply adding a "/here" command to output your current coordiantes would help majorly.
Just being able to copy the coordinates to chat in creative would be so nice to all us that uses /fill and /clone commands in minecraft
Yes, please.  While battling the enderdragon, it is absolutely necessary to hit the target on the first try while throwing an enderpearl.  I usually have to throw three or four.
This sounds like a significant oversight on Mojang's part, voted.
The struggle is real for us bedrock users.

You know when you hold a fishing rod and have this bar above the hotbar thats says "fish", and when you press on it you can use the rod? Well I though that that should be added to enderpearls, snowballs ect to make it faster and easier to use them, since we moblie players have to press down for it to throw. I'm just adding this because I think it would be a good addition along with what you said, which I strongly support.

This is something that should be obvious it makes it so that I don't make splash potions but this would make it work much better. Maybe you would hold and release the potion but you could also just tap because it didn't need to charge up.
If there is anyway to make a addon pls someone find a way to make it
This would be FANTASTIC!
I agree.  I hate having to quit the game to switch to a different version of Minecraft.
Thatâ€™s the best idea I have heard for Minecraft. EVER
This would be awesome, especially for certain servers that need specific versions to play
That would be cool, as I have never played the original version of MCPE.
also stop slimes from spawning
I've been waiting for years for this to come to bedrock. I didn't know it had been permanently removed!

I agree with everything.  Slimes are a nuisance and I now hate them.  For years I lived off of xbox 360 And I know the ins and outs of 360 minecraft.  It needs to be updated but they dis continued it.  :(    Bringing it back to life(adding its features to bedrock and java)would be fantastic  :)
You can easily get rid of slime by turning off mob spawning or peaceful. Mob spawning so no mobs can spawn naturally and peaceful because you should know why
